adjective.description: Free from an obligation or liability imposed on others.
examples: these patients are exempt from all charges
they are not exempt from criticism

verb.description: Free (a person or organization) from an obligation or liability imposed on others.
examples: they were exempted from paying the tax

noun.description: A person who is exempt from something, especially the payment of tax.

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin exemptus taken out, freed, past participle of eximere.
